name: San Juaquin Kit Fox
overview: Small foxes with large ears colored black on the backsides, slender bodies, long legs, and black-tipped bushy tails that stick straight out behind them. Their bodies are lightly colored on the underside and grey on top during the winter and tan during the summer.
behavior: Kit foxes are mostly active when hunting at night, but occasionally venture out during the day. They eat small rodents such as black-tailed hares, desert cottontails, mice, squirrels, birds, and lizards.
habitat: The Kit Fox is located the San Joaquin Valley. They live in dens that are either man made or natural to protect themselves and their young from predators. They change dens often, going through about twenty-five a year.
tags: mammal san joaquin kit fox vulpes macrotis mutica tail  mammals animal animals
